quest.name: Homecoming
journal: Guildmaster Luciane wants you to attend to your fellow archers.
Both Silvairre and Leih Aliapoh appear to be lost in thought. Speak first with Silvairre and see what is troubling him.

Silvairre grudgingly reveals his intention to leave the guild. He is determined to bring Pawah Mujuuk to justice, believing that it will grant him a measure of redemption for the time he failed to do so as a Quiverman. Realizing that you cannot sway him from his path, you resolve to turn your attention to Leih, who seems utterly crestfallen.

As if Silvairre's announcement weren't shocking enough, Leih declares her intention to leave not only the guild, but Gridania at large. Before she departs, however, she would speak with you in private. Meet her in the South Shroud and see her off on her journey.

Leih reveals that she believed her place to be with her fellow Keepers of the Moon, and not with the people of Gridania. However, she could not bear to let Pawah murder you, and was thus denied the company of her kind. With nowhere left to go, she asks you to meet her at the Bannock, and help her to understand how one can live as an outsider in Gridania.

Leih flies into a rage and attacks you, leaving you little choice but to fight, as a crowd of slack-jawed Twin Adder recruits look on. After you subdue her, she awakens as if from a trance, realizing that the fear of dishonoring her old family, who perished in the Calamity, was preventing her from embracing her new one. She resolves to return to the guild and be with those who know her best. Follow in her wake and inform Luciane that all is well.

Before you can utter a word, Luciane bids you stop, and states that merely looking at the returning Leih's eyes has told her all that she needs to know. She thanks you for helping Leih to see that her place is with the guild, and hopes that you will be of similar aid to other archers who lose their way.

※The next archer quest will be available from Luciane upon reaching level 30.
objectives: Meet Leih Aliapoh in the South Shroud.
Speak with Leih Aliapoh at the Bannock.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, I had hoped you would come. You may be able to help. I am concerned about Leih and Silvairre...

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: They show signs of losing perspective, and... Well, mayhap it is best you see for yourself. I cannot help but feel that both would benefit from your counsel.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Consider this a personal request, Forename.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Hm? Oh, gods... Did Luciane send you to pester me, by any chance? This is hardly her concern, and it is most definitely not yours.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: If you must know, I have decided to leave the guild.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I mean to track down Pawah Mujuuk and finish what we started. The Gods' Quiver and Wood Wailers seem content to ignore our warnings, but I will not let her escape again.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I already made that mistake once, and it cost me my place in the Gods' Quiver.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Aye, the foolish young sentry of whom I once spoke─he was me. <sigh> We had her, Forename. There was no escape. But then she began to wail about a wounded comrade, one who would surely die without her help... She looked me straight in the eye and begged...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: And I blinked. I failed to see through the most elementary ruse. I failed Gridania and the Gods' Quiver...and while that can never be forgiven, mayhap I can reclaim a measure of honor by stopping her.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...But a wanderer like you would not understand what it means to betray your people.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Worry not─I do not intend to leave just yet. I will continue to gather information until I am certain of Mujuuk's whereabouts. Make no mistake, though─it is only a matter of time.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Now run along, will you? Oh, and if you are so concerned about your fellow guildmates, you should attend to that moping Miqo'te. The sight of her shuffling around whilst staring at her feet is bad for morale.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...Not that it matters to me.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Oh...it's you. Tell me, Forename, do you ever think about home? Do you ever wish you could go back?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Mine was just another poor village in the Twelveswood. The fields were more stone than soil, and merchants hardly ever bothered to visit. We didn't have a lot...but we didn't need it.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And then the Calamity came. I remember running, and the screams... It was so loud, Forename...so unbearably loud... And then I was here, in a strange city, surrounded by more people than I'd ever seen, and I didn't know any of them.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: But I knew how to hunt. I was always good at hunting, Forename, and the guild gave me a place to get better.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: At least I thought I had gotten better. She...Pawah Mujuuk...she was so much more...

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I've been thinking, Forename, that maybe this is a sign. Maybe Silvairre is right, and this guild─this city─is no place for an outsider like me.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And so I've decided to leave. I'm glad to have known you, Forename, even if it was only for a short while.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Forgive me if this is too selfish a request, but before I go, I would like to meet with you one last time.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Alone, in the South Shroud. These...Gridanians would not understand.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: No! Don't hurt herhim!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: And there I was, thinkin' ye mightn't accept my kind invitation!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: ...I don't recall invitin' herhim, though... 'Tis rude to presume, missysonny, an' I do so hate rudeness...

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Wait! It's not herhis fault─it's mine! I invited herhim. SheHe's a member of the Archers' Guild, like me─and shehe's not Gridanian!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Ahhh...I do begin to recall herhis face... Aye, knows how to hold a bow, that one. Well, shehe ain't the typical recruit, but I reckon I might be willin' to make an exception.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: No, no─it's not like that. I just...I wanted to say good-bye.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Forename, ever since I met Pawah, I've been at a loss. But I realize now that my place isn't at the guild...with the Gridanians.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: They'll never accept me. This is where I belong, with my people, carrying on our traditions. Our archery─not Gridania's.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: It's all I have left, Forename. So I'm going with Pawah. Maybe you don't understand now, but...just promise me you won't tell Luciane...or Silvairre.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: As you wish.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The hells I won't!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Forename...

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Made yer peace with yer little friend, have ye? Right then, let's get on with it!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Heh! I had a feelin' shehe might be harborin' a few nigglin' objections. Worry not, sister...

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Put an arrow in herShoot the bastard!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: NO!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Ain't no love lost 'twixt ye an' the guild, is there? Then what's the problem with featherin' a bloody 'venturer? No bugger'll miss herhim.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I'll miss herhim, all right!? So just...just stop!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Dear me... An' I had such high hopes for you, Miss Aliapoh... Waste o' bloody time! A Keeper what's lost her nerve's about as much use to me as a glass bow.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: But there's no sport in killin' captured prey.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Ack! I'd better not see neither o' ye again, 'cause if I do, I'll show ye what happens to prey what's daft enough to get caught twice. Away, sisters! Away!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: How do you do it, Forename? How do you live in this place─with these people?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And why do you even bother? What have they ever given you beside scorn? Well? What do you see in them, Forename?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Even though you joined the guild after I did, you've come so far, so quickly. Maybe you've even surpassed me...

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I have to know how you've done it. I have to know what it is that I'm doing wrong...

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...And there's only one way I can think of to find out. Meet me at the Bannock.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Shall we begin, Forename?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Whenever you're ready. I'll be waiting.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Then defend yourself! Show me what these people have taught you!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> It's so simple...

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: You have opened your eyes, and looked beyond your masters' faults. You've accepted their teachings and taken them to heart. Even Silvairre, for all his bigotry, wishes only to preserve his traditions.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I lost sight of everyone else's struggles and became obsessed with mine own. I was so afraid to let go of my cherished notion of archery─my family's notion─and learn another way. I didn't want to betray them...or dishonor their memory.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...But I have a family here too─a family that sees the wider world, and is willing to show me how blinkered I have become.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: As archers, we train our eyes and minds to be unforgiving─to defy any attempt at concealment, and discern the naked truth. It is little wonder then that I have neglected to look inside myself until now. Though unquestionably worthwhile, I have found the experience rather...excruciating. Ahem!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I know now that I belong at the guild, together with you and Luciane...

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...And, yes, even that bloody Wildwood. Gods help me─I think I might actually miss him...

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Welcome home, Forename.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: You need not say a word. One look at Leih's eyes was enough.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Thank you for returning her to us.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: When we focus on a single goal and pursue it with passion and fervor, it becomes easy to lose sight of what else lies before us.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: With your skill and vision, Forename, you can help your fellow archers to look beyond themselves and remember their comrades. I hope I can count on your support in the future.

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Homecoming”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I said fight me, damn it! Why are you holding back!?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Is that all you've got!? I know you can do better!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Not bad...but I'm not finished yet!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: For my people...for my family...for me!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I...I see now...
